alert.note: Alert for Tippecanoe (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 12:04PM EST until February 24 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Driftwood River near Edinburgh. East Fork White River at Shoals. Tippecanoe River near Delphi. Wildcat Creek near Lafayette. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Petersburg. .Rainfall last night and this morning of around an inch to an inch and a half along with a mixed precipitation system coming Wednesday night through Thursday night will create additional flooding on area rivers. Minor flooding is expected for most locations, but moderate flooding is possible on lower parts of the White and Wabash. Flooding along the main stem rivers is expected to continue into at least the first week of March. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wildcat Creek near Lafayette. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding of lowland areas in progress in portions of Tippecanoe County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 10.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued by late this evening.
